speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: SCENE III. Dunsinane. A room in the castle.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, Doctor, and Attendants

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring me no more reports; let them fly all:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till Birnam wood remove to Dunsinane,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I cannot taint with fear. What's the boy Malcolm?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Was he not born of woman? The spirits that know

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: All mortal consequences have pronounced me thus:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: 'Fear not, Macbeth; no man that's born of woman

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall e'er have power upon thee.' Then fly,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: false thanes,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And mingle with the English epicures:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The mind I sway by and the heart I bear

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall never sag with doubt nor shake with fear.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The devil damn thee black, thou cream-faced loon!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Where got'st thou that goose look?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: There is ten thousand--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Geese, villain!

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Soldiers, sir.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Go prick thy face, and over-red thy fear,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou lily-liver'd boy. What soldiers, patch?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Death of thy soul! those linen cheeks of thine

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Are counsellors to fear. What soldiers, whey-face?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: The English force, so please you.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Take thy face hence.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Seyton!--I am sick at heart,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When I behold--Seyton, I say!--This push

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Will cheer me ever, or disseat me now.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have lived long enough: my way of life

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is fall'n into the sear, the yellow leaf;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And that which should accompany old age,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As honour, love, obedience, troops of friends,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I must not look to have; but, in their stead,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Curses, not loud but deep, mouth-honour, breath,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which the poor heart would fain deny, and dare not. Seyton!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter SEYTON

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: What is your gracious pleasure?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What news more?

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: All is confirm'd, my lord, which was reported.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll fight till from my bones my flesh be hack'd.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Give me my armour.

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: 'Tis not needed yet.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll put it on.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Send out more horses; skirr the country round;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hang those that talk of fear. Give me mine armour.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How does your patient, doctor?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Not so sick, my lord,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: As she is troubled with thick coming fancies,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: That keep her from her rest.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cure her of that.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Canst thou not minister to a mind diseased,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Pluck from the memory a rooted sorrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Raze out the written troubles of the brain

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And with some sweet oblivious antidote

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cleanse the stuff'd bosom of that perilous stuff

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which weighs upon the heart?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Therein the patient

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Must minister to himself.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Throw physic to the dogs; I'll none of it.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, put mine armour on; give me my staff.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Seyton, send out. Doctor, the thanes fly from me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, sir, dispatch. If thou couldst, doctor, cast

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The water of my land, find her disease,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And purge it to a sound and pristine health,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I would applaud thee to the very echo,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That should applaud again.--Pull't off, I say.--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What rhubarb, cyme, or what purgative drug,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Would scour these English hence? Hear'st thou of them?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Ay, my good lord; your royal preparation

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Makes us hear something.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring it after me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I will not be afraid of death and bane,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till Birnam forest come to Dunsinane.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: [Aside]  Were I from Dunsinane away and clear,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Profit again should hardly draw me here.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Exeunt
